ygData.subject: Re: RE: 1hb weapons that are light enough to use...
ygData.msgSnippet: also, to train up 1hb you can use a fools gold stein. bought at the fools gold inn in rivervale.  weighs something like 1 and its 2dmg/some delay. again not
ygData.messageBody:
also, to train up 1hb you can use a fools gold stein. bought at the fools
gold inn in rivervale. weighs something like 1 and its 2dmg/some delay.

again not much of a weapon, but something to use to train up the skill

On 22 Jan 2000, ANTON NORTH wrote:

> From: ANTON NORTH <ahnorth@...>
>
> Raean Bloodyhands asked about 1-handed blunt weapons that are light enough for
> a monk to use.
>
> Check here:
>
> http://eq.stomped.com/monks/
>
> and go to the "Weapons" section on the right hand side. Here is a
> comprehensive list of weapons that Monks can use.
>
> Most of them are heavy, being around 3 weight. But the Humerous Handled mace
> is light (although once you get it, most likely you'll want to trade it in for
> the Treeant fists), and probably the best one is the Sharkbone WarHammer.
>
> Alarys, Silent Fist Monk of the Final Circle
>
>
